channel.title: Lecture on STAT-5014 Fall 2019
channel.description: Recent content in Lecture on STAT-5014 Fall 2019

item.title: R functions and logic, good programming practices
item.description: Today’s Agenda Review data munging and creating tidy datasets Introduce good programming practices R functions for next if else while loop Data wrangling - messy data symptoms Column headers are values, not variable names. Multiple variables are stored in one column. Variables are stored in both rows and columns. Multiple types of observational units are stored in the same table. A single observational unit is stored in multiple tables.

item.title: Data wrangling, munging and creating tidy datasets
item.description: Today’s Agenda Review data importing, cleaning and munging data Creating tidy datasets Using the tidyverse In-class tidy’ing Data wrangling Data wrangling or munging is the process of going from raw to useful data. This can be 60-80% of the time spent on a project. Data Wrangling Cheatsheet Steps may include any or all of the following: Step Examples Import read.

item.title: Data structures, Reproducible Research, loading, cleaning and munging data in R
item.description: Today’s Agenda Review the concepts of Reproducible Research Review Git Importing, cleaning and munging data Summarizing and exploring data Vectors, matrices, and data frames Homework 3 Thoughts/issues from last time/homework Homework -Swirl – thoughts? -Git – ok? -R – any problems? Knitr and LaTeX? Reproducible Research | Review This was the scenario: You had worked 6 months to analyze a data set. Someone else analyzes the data and comes to different conclusions.

item.title: Introductions, Reproducible Research, (a little) R, and (a little) Git
item.description: Today’s Agenda Introduce the course Introduce the concepts of Reproducible Research Introduce Git Introduce R as the (main) platform for the course Homework 1 Course Learning Objectives R programming Reproducible research concepts Good programming practices Data cleaning and munging Git fundamentals Markdown Python basics Tentative Course Lecture Schedule https://rsettlage.github.io/STAT_5014_Fall_2019/schedule/ Passing the course Q. How do you pass the course?? A. Do the homework AND participate.
